info.game_comments:
2009 Tournament of Champions quarterfinal game 5.
From Las Vegas.

(1, 1).clue: In 1856 Fremont, the first Republican candidate for president, lost to this Democrat

(2, 1).clue: "I Dreamed A Dream","Master Of The House"

(3, 1).clue: This red, black-spotted beetle, Coccinella septempunctata, is used to control aphids

(4, 1).clue: She served as the whip of the House Democrats from Jan. 2002 to Jan. 2003; she got a big promotion later

(6, 1).clue: In song, this, this, this, this precedes "life is but a dream"

(1, 2).clue: On his second expedition to map out this route, Fremont followed it from Missouri to the Columbia River

(2, 2).clue: "Almost Like Being In Love","I'll Go Home With Bonnie Jean"

(3, 2).clue: As a defensive mechanism, some of these "thousand-legged worms" exude hydrogen cyanide fluid

(4, 2).clue: After lines like "They call me Mr. Tibbs", they call him Mr. this

(6, 2).clue: This adverb means twice a year

(1, 3).clue: Beginning in 1842 this frontiersman would be a frequent guide for Fremont on his expeditions

(3, 3).clue: This "pious" predator is the only insect that can move its head from side to side without moving other body parts

(4, 3).clue: He sold 300 million books, including 2000's "The Sky Is Falling", which he wrote in his 80s

(6, 3).clue: For burial at Arlington National Cemetery, a veteran must have been discharged this way

(1, 4).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew indicates a map on the monitor.) The Great Salt Lake, the Humboldt River & Death Valley are all part of a desert region of internal drainage Fremont called the Great this

(3, 4).clue: These insects belong to the superfamily Papilionoidea in the order Lepidoptera

(4, 4).clue: Nancy was the first name of this "Lady", who in 1929 tried to form a women's party in the British House of Commons

(5, 4).clue: Roger B. Taney, after fighting the Bank of the U.S.,1834

(6, 4).clue: This word completes the "Friends of the Earth" slogan "Think globally, act..."

(1, 5).clue: In 1841 Fremont secretly married the daughter of this Missouri senator (not the mural guy)

(2, 5).clue: "Cinderella At The Grave","Giants In The Sky"

(3, 5).clue: Also called the 17-year locust, this loud insect reaches over 100 decibels

(4, 5).clue: S.J. stood for Sidney Joseph in the name of this New Yorker satirist

(6, 5).clue: From the Greek for "diagonal", it means "directly" when found modifying the word "opposed"

(1, 1).clue: Green serpentine, seen here, is made into a gemstone that's a common substitute for this one

(2, 1).clue: In 1959's "Some Like It Hot", this then 30-year-old historic event begins the movie & sends our heroes into drag

(3, 1).clue: This "Bar at the Folies-Bergere" artist painted several portraits of Impressionist Berthe Morisot, his sister-in-law

(4, 1).clue: A 1-ounce first-class letter costs this much to mail

(5, 1).clue: This Joyce novel is about a trip to a bath, funeral, library, maternity hospital & brothel

(6, 1).clue: The butte rises from the western plain like a stick of this on a plate

(1, 2).clue: Kernite, a major source of borax, is named for Kern County in this California desert where it is mined

(2, 2).clue: Peggy was the real name of this 1950s non-human co-star of Ronald Reagan

(3, 2).clue: His 1911 painting "I and the Village" uses the simple shapes of Russian folk art

(4, 2).clue: They're the Rose Bowl champs, having beaten Penn State 38-24

(5, 2).clue: It ends, "His... throat a-bellow as he sings a song of the younger world, which is the song of the pack"

(6, 2).clue: To find this type of dictionary on your computer, double click the Alex icon

(1, 3).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew scrapes a rock against a white sample surface.)  The chief ore of iron, this mineral, is named for the fact that its powder, or the streak that it leaves, is blood red

(2, 3).clue: In response to criticism of her roles, this 1939 Oscar winner said, "I'd rather play a maid than be one"

(3, 3).clue: As a child, this Florentine fresco painter was placed in the care of a monastery; he took his vows in 1421

(4, 3).clue: By Obama's choice, he remained Secretary of Defense

(5, 3).clue: "The Last Chronicle of Barset" ends this Victorian author's Barsetshire series

(6, 3).clue: Show the policeman a clever trick--get your hand out of this restraining device

(1, 4).clue: Carrara, Italy is famous for its quarries of this rock

(2, 4).clue: When the star wasn't available, his brother Joe Estevez was brought in to do voiceovers on this 1979 film

(3, 4).clue: When he first came to Hoboken from Holland, this abstract Expressionist, who died at 93, painted houses

(4, 4).clue: The only 2 Dow stocks to rise in 2008 were McDonald's, which posted a 6% gain, & this retail giant, up 18%

(5, 4).clue: Yvonne tries to save her husband Geoffrey on the Day of the Dead in this Malcolm Lowry novel

(6, 4).clue: I said I'd found this type of cast gold bar, spurring others to look as well

(1, 5).clue: Obsidian is described as having this type of luster, from the Latin for "glassy"

(2, 5).clue: This 2004 biblical tale had the biggest U.S. gross of any film in a foreign language

(3, 5).clue: Capturing the frothy essence of the Rococo style, "The Swing" by this painter is seen here

(4, 5).clue: They're the 2 states that seated only one senator each for the opening of the 111th Congress in 2009

(5, 5).clue: "In the Belly of the Beast" is a prison memoir by Jack Henry Abbott, a protege of this writer who died in November 2007

(6, 5).clue: To the fear of a cholera epidemic Robert Koch helped put a stop, discovering this type of tiny pathogen

(0, 0).clue: The name of this river whose lower reaches run through Ghana is from Portuguese for "turn" or "bend"
